qas.question: How much had Eton received in farming subsidies in 2005?
Under what policy was Eton able to receive funds without farming?
What did Panorama say was the documented reason Eton was eligible for farming subsidies?
In what year was the Taxpayers' Alliance established?
In what year was the Common Agricultural Policy established?
In what year was Panorama established?
How much in farming subsidies did Eton receive in 2012?

context: A Freedom of Information request in 2005 revealed that Eton had received <a0_0>£2,652<a0_0/> in farming subsidies in 2004 under the <a1_0>Common Agricultural Policy<a1_0/>. Asked to explain under what grounds it was eligible to receive farming subsidies, Eton admitted that it was 'a bit of a mystery'. The TaxPayers' Alliance also stated that Eton had received a total of <b6_0>£5,300<b6_0/> in CAP subsidies between <b3_0><b4_0>2002<b4_0/><b3_0/> and <b5_0>2007<b5_0/>. Panorama revealed in March 2012 that farming subsidies were granted to Eton for '<a2_0>environmental improvements<a2_0/>', in effect 'being paid without having to do any farming at all'.
